message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.DS 

This paper deals with reinforcement learning in Markov decision processes, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. The most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper proposes a framework for entropy-regularized reinforcement learning and discusses the convergence properties of various algorithms. The paper also touches on topics related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), and control systems (cs.SY), as these fields often involve decision-making under uncertainty. Finally, the paper uses linear programming and convex optimization techniques, which are relevant to the field of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
